content: you will be able to decide if the ridge on the toe will be too irritating to enjoy wearing the socks the easiest but least technically proficient option will be to simply run the end of the yarn through all the open stitches and cinch it closed for this option work your decrease rounds further until you have only 8 sts left as otherwise you will get bulky gathering folds over the toe and this too can be uncomfortable darn in your yarn ends neatly on the inside and immediately cast on the second sock - nothing brings on sss second sock syndrome faster than hiding a single finished sock in a project bag out of sight out of mind follow the hopefully copious notes you took while working the first sock and the second one will not only go faster but it will also most probably turn out to be identical to the first one making your first completed pair of socks a sounding success well done you glossary st sts stitch stitches k knit p purl tbl through the back loop sl slip purlwise unless noted otherwise k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches separately as if to knit insert left needle into these two stitches from the right and knit onto right needle p2tog purl 2 stitches together sock page 8 sock anatomy cuff leg heel flap gusset toe heel turn foot sock page 9
